trans-unit.source: The Device API is an HTTP/REST API allowing to retrieve and enrich the information gathered by the Mobile Engagement platform about all devices (i.e users) using your application.This information can be injected into the Mobile Engagement platform by the application itself (by using Mobile Engagement SDK’s API) or by an external service (by using this API).
trans-unit.target: The Device API is an HTTP/REST API allowing to retrieve and enrich the information gathered by the Mobile Engagement platform about all devices (i.e users) using your application.This information can be injected into the Mobile Engagement platform by the application itself (by using Mobile Engagement SDK’s API) or by an external service (by using this API).

trans-unit.source: Then, this information can be used to segment the audience of push campaigns performed on your application (e.g. Mobile Engagement’s Reach and Segments modules allow you to define audience criteria based on this information).
trans-unit.target: Then, this information can be used to segment the audience of push campaigns performed on your application (e.g. Mobile Engagement’s Reach and Segments modules allow you to define audience criteria based on this information).

trans-unit.source: The Device API gives you access to the following information:
trans-unit.target: The Device API gives you access to the following information:

trans-unit.source: The complete list of devices on which your application has been installed (read only)
trans-unit.target: The complete list of devices on which your application has been installed (read only)

trans-unit.source: The information associated to each device running your application
trans-unit.target: The information associated to each device running your application

trans-unit.source: User profiling data (custom user identifier, gender, birth date, opt-in etc.)
trans-unit.target: User profiling data (custom user identifier, gender, birth date, opt-in etc.)

trans-unit.source: Customer specific data (an unlimited set of key/value pairs)
trans-unit.target: Customer specific data (an unlimited set of key/value pairs)

trans-unit.source: Usage data (date of first session, date of last session, etc.)
trans-unit.target: Usage data (date of first session, date of last session, etc.)

trans-unit.source: The last geo-location data received (country, region, locality) (read only)
trans-unit.target: The last geo-location data received (country, region, locality) (read only)

trans-unit.source: The last technical data received (device model, carrier name, network type, etc.)
trans-unit.target: The last technical data received (device model, carrier name, network type, etc.)

trans-unit.source: When the HTTP method used is <codeInline>POST</codeInline>, parameters must be provided in URL-encoded form.
trans-unit.target: When the HTTP method used is <codeInline>POST</codeInline>, parameters must be provided in URL-encoded form.

trans-unit.source: Also, if not mentioned otherwise, each parameter is required.
trans-unit.target: Also, if not mentioned otherwise, each parameter is required.

trans-unit.source: In order to access the API, basic access authentication is required using Application ID:API Key as the userid:password pair.
trans-unit.target: In order to access the API, basic access authentication is required using Application ID:API Key as the userid:password pair.

trans-unit.source: This authentication scheme must be used for all URLs part of the API.
trans-unit.target: This authentication scheme must be used for all URLs part of the API.

trans-unit.source: Your application’s API Key is a sensible piece of information that you MUST keep secret.
trans-unit.target: Your application’s API Key is a sensible piece of information that you MUST keep secret.

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the common status codes that can be returned by the APIs.
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the common status codes that can be returned by the APIs.

trans-unit.source: Application is not enabled or Device API is disabled for this application.
trans-unit.target: Application is not enabled or Device API is disabled for this application.

trans-unit.source: You can do the following with resources:
trans-unit.target: You can do the following with resources:

trans-unit.source: Get the list of devices on which an application has been installed.
trans-unit.target: Get the list of devices on which an application has been installed.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.

trans-unit.source: A list of all the device identifiers separated by a newline.
trans-unit.target: A list of all the device identifiers separated by a newline.

trans-unit.source: Note that this API will stream the result; the content length cannot be returned.
trans-unit.target: Note that this API will stream the result; the content length cannot be returned.

trans-unit.source: Get the information associated with a device running an application.
trans-unit.target: Get the information associated with a device running an application.

trans-unit.source: Devices can be identified by their regular device identifier or by a custom user identifier.
trans-unit.target: Devices can be identified by their regular device identifier or by a custom user identifier.

trans-unit.source: The custom user identifier is simply a special reserved tag, which key is <codeInline>userid</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The custom user identifier is simply a special reserved tag, which key is <codeInline>userid</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: To set this special tag, use the Tag command or use the SDK’s sendAppInfo function.
trans-unit.target: To set this special tag, use the Tag command or use the SDK’s sendAppInfo function.

trans-unit.source: The following parameters are specific this API:
trans-unit.target: The following parameters are specific this API:

trans-unit.source: Device identifier (cannot be used if userid has been specified).
trans-unit.target: Device identifier (cannot be used if userid has been specified).

trans-unit.source: User identifier (cannot be used if deviceid has been specified).
trans-unit.target: User identifier (cannot be used if deviceid has been specified).

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.

trans-unit.source: A JSON object describing device information.
trans-unit.target: A JSON object describing device information.

trans-unit.source: The object has the following properties:
trans-unit.target: The object has the following properties:

trans-unit.source: First time the device used the application in milliseconds since epoch.
trans-unit.target: First time the device used the application in milliseconds since epoch.

trans-unit.source: Last time the device used the application in milliseconds since epoch.
trans-unit.target: Last time the device used the application in milliseconds since epoch.

trans-unit.source: Timestamp corresponding to the info object in milliseconds since epoch.
trans-unit.target: Timestamp corresponding to the info object in milliseconds since epoch.

trans-unit.source: Timestamp corresponding to the location object in milliseconds since epoch.
trans-unit.target: Timestamp corresponding to the location object in milliseconds since epoch.

trans-unit.source: Boolean indicating if native push notifications (like Android’s GCM or Apple’s APNS) are enabled for the application.
trans-unit.target: Boolean indicating if native push notifications (like Android’s GCM or Apple’s APNS) are enabled for the application.

trans-unit.source: This boolean is set to true when the application registers successfully to the native push service, and set to false when the native push service reports to Mobile Engagement that the application can no longer be pushed (which means that it has been uninstalled).
trans-unit.target: This boolean is set to true when the application registers successfully to the native push service, and set to false when the native push service reports to Mobile Engagement that the application can no longer be pushed (which means that it has been uninstalled).

trans-unit.source: This report is performed a few hours after Mobile Engagement has tried to perform a native push to a device on which the application has been uninstalled.
trans-unit.target: This report is performed a few hours after Mobile Engagement has tried to perform a native push to a device on which the application has been uninstalled.

trans-unit.source: Boolean indicating if native push notifications (like Android’s GCM or Apple’s APNS) are enabled for the application.
trans-unit.target: Boolean indicating if native push notifications (like Android’s GCM or Apple’s APNS) are enabled for the application.

trans-unit.source: This boolean is set to true when the application registers successfully to the native push service, and set to false when the native push service reports to Mobile Engagement that the application can no longer be pushed (which means that it has been uninstalled).
trans-unit.target: This boolean is set to true when the application registers successfully to the native push service, and set to false when the native push service reports to Mobile Engagement that the application can no longer be pushed (which means that it has been uninstalled).

trans-unit.source: This report is performed a few hours after Mobile Engagement has tried to perform a native push to a device on which the application has been uninstalled.
trans-unit.target: This report is performed a few hours after Mobile Engagement has tried to perform a native push to a device on which the application has been uninstalled.

trans-unit.source: Last technical data received (concerning device, system, network and application identification).
trans-unit.target: Last technical data received (concerning device, system, network and application identification).

trans-unit.source: The offset in minutes from UTC for the device time zone, including daylight savings time.
trans-unit.target: The offset in minutes from UTC for the device time zone, including daylight savings time.

trans-unit.source: An administrative region of the nation, such as a state or province.
trans-unit.target: An administrative region of the nation, such as a state or province.

trans-unit.source: A locality within the administrative region, such as a town or city.
trans-unit.target: A locality within the administrative region, such as a town or city.

trans-unit.source: Registered tags (install tracking tags, user profiling tags and customer specific tags).
trans-unit.target: Registered tags (install tracking tags, user profiling tags and customer specific tags).

trans-unit.source: Install tracking tags (reserved by Mobile Engagement, automatically registered by the Mobile Engagement Tracking SDK, should not be overwritten).
trans-unit.target: Install tracking tags (reserved by Mobile Engagement, automatically registered by the Mobile Engagement Tracking SDK, should not be overwritten).

trans-unit.source: Application store from which the application has been downloaded.
trans-unit.target: Application store from which the application has been downloaded.

trans-unit.source: Source (promotion campaign identifier) leading to the the download.
trans-unit.target: Source (promotion campaign identifier) leading to the the download.

trans-unit.source: User profiling tags (reserved by Mobile Engagement, but need to be registered by the customer).
trans-unit.target: User profiling tags (reserved by Mobile Engagement, but need to be registered by the customer).

trans-unit.source: User birth date (CCYY-MM-DD format: e.g. 1969-12-07 stands for 7 Dec 1969).
trans-unit.target: User birth date (CCYY-MM-DD format: e.g. 1969-12-07 stands for 7 Dec 1969).

trans-unit.source: User global opt-in to Mobile Engagement Reach service (true or false).
trans-unit.target: User global opt-in to Mobile Engagement Reach service (true or false).

trans-unit.source: An integer bit mask indicating the types of notifications enabled in the application (i.e. badges, sounds, alerts and Newsstand assets).
trans-unit.target: An integer bit mask indicating the types of notifications enabled in the application (i.e. badges, sounds, alerts and Newsstand assets).

trans-unit.source: This value is the same as the return value from UIApplication#enabledRemoteNotificationTypes (15: all types of notifications are enabled, 0: none are enabled).
trans-unit.target: This value is the same as the return value from UIApplication#enabledRemoteNotificationTypes (15: all types of notifications are enabled, 0: none are enabled).

trans-unit.source: An integer indicating the current badge value of the application.
trans-unit.target: An integer indicating the current badge value of the application.

trans-unit.source: This value is used and updated by native push[need link] campaigns in the Reach API[need link].
trans-unit.target: This value is used and updated by native push[need link] campaigns in the Reach API[need link].

trans-unit.source: Customer specific tags (need to be registered by the customer).
trans-unit.target: Customer specific tags (need to be registered by the customer).

trans-unit.source: Custom boolean tag (one of true or false).
trans-unit.target: Custom boolean tag (one of true or false).

trans-unit.source: Custom date tag (CCYY-MM-DD format: e.g. 1969-12-07 stands for 7 Dec 1969).
trans-unit.target: Custom date tag (CCYY-MM-DD format: e.g. 1969-12-07 stands for 7 Dec 1969).

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to retrieve information on a device using <codeInline>deviceid</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to retrieve information on a device using <codeInline>deviceid</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to retrieve information on a device using <codeInline>userid</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to retrieve information on a device using <codeInline>userid</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Update the tags registered for a set of devices running an application.
trans-unit.target: Update the tags registered for a set of devices running an application.

trans-unit.source: Devices can be identified by their regular device identifier or by a custom user identifier.
trans-unit.target: Devices can be identified by their regular device identifier or by a custom user identifier.

trans-unit.source: The custom user identifier is simply a special reserved tag, which key is <codeInline>userid</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The custom user identifier is simply a special reserved tag, which key is <codeInline>userid</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: To set this special tag, use this command or use the SDK’s <codeInline>sendAppInfo</codeInline> function.
trans-unit.target: To set this special tag, use this command or use the SDK’s <codeInline>sendAppInfo</codeInline> function.

trans-unit.source: Updates are performed asynchronously, meaning that a few seconds are needed before the modifications appear in the results of the Get command.
trans-unit.target: Updates are performed asynchronously, meaning that a few seconds are needed before the modifications appear in the results of the Get command.

trans-unit.source: The following parameters are specific this command:
trans-unit.target: The following parameters are specific this command:

trans-unit.source: The way users are identified in the tags parameter: deviceid or userid.Default value: deviceid.
trans-unit.target: The way users are identified in the tags parameter: deviceid or userid.Default value: deviceid.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is true, tags with a null value will be deleted.Default value: false.
trans-unit.target: If this parameter is true, tags with a null value will be deleted.Default value: false.

trans-unit.source: A JSON object describing the set of tags to record for a set of users.Limited to 1000 max identifiers.
trans-unit.target: A JSON object describing the set of tags to record for a set of users.Limited to 1000 max identifiers.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.

trans-unit.source: A JSON array containing all identifiers that could not be resolved to an existing device.
trans-unit.target: A JSON array containing all identifiers that could not be resolved to an existing device.

trans-unit.source: The following status code may be returned for this command:
trans-unit.target: The following status code may be returned for this command:

trans-unit.source: Too many identifiers (current limit is 1000), or POST URL-encoded entity is over 2MB.
trans-unit.target: Too many identifiers (current limit is 1000), or POST URL-encoded entity is over 2MB.

trans-unit.source: In this example, <codeInline>deviceId2</codeInline> does not exist.
trans-unit.target: In this example, <codeInline>deviceId2</codeInline> does not exist.

trans-unit.source: In this example, <codeInline>userId2</codeInline> does not exist.
trans-unit.target: In this example, <codeInline>userId2</codeInline> does not exist.

trans-unit.source: Query the information associated to the devices running an application.
trans-unit.target: Query the information associated to the devices running an application.

trans-unit.source: The queried device information is the same as the <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#get" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get</link> command, but currently limited to the <languageKeyword>appInfo</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>meta</languageKeyword> properties.
trans-unit.target: The queried device information is the same as the <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#get" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get</link> command, but currently limited to the <languageKeyword>appInfo</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>meta</languageKeyword> properties.

trans-unit.source: The following parameters are specific this command:
trans-unit.target: The following parameters are specific this command:

trans-unit.source: A JSON object describing the query to perform.
trans-unit.target: A JSON object describing the query to perform.

trans-unit.source: See the following table for a description of the allowed properties.
trans-unit.target: See the following table for a description of the allowed properties.

trans-unit.source: An array listing the keys of all tags that must be retrieved (or true to return them all).
trans-unit.target: An array listing the keys of all tags that must be retrieved (or true to return them all).

trans-unit.source: No tag is fetched if this property is missing.
trans-unit.target: No tag is fetched if this property is missing.

trans-unit.source: An array listing the meta fields that must be retrieved (or true to return them all).
trans-unit.target: An array listing the meta fields that must be retrieved (or true to return them all).

trans-unit.source: No meta field is fetched if this property is missing.
trans-unit.target: No meta field is fetched if this property is missing.

trans-unit.source: If set, returns only tags and meta fields modified after this timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch).
trans-unit.target: If set, returns only tags and meta fields modified after this timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch).

trans-unit.source: If set, returns only tags and meta fields modified before this timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch).
trans-unit.target: If set, returns only tags and meta fields modified before this timestamp (in milliseconds since epoch).

trans-unit.source: Boolean; if set to true, the returned stream is formatted as a JSON array.
trans-unit.target: Boolean; if set to true, the returned stream is formatted as a JSON array.

trans-unit.source: By default, it returns objects without array delimiters.
trans-unit.target: By default, it returns objects without array delimiters.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#common_headers" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers </link> for headers and parameters that are used by all requests related to Device.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>MIME Type</languageKeyword>: application/json if returnArray is set to true; otherwise, application/javascript.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>MIME Type</languageKeyword>: application/json if returnArray is set to true; otherwise, application/javascript.

trans-unit.source: A streamed set of JSON objects describing the information associated to the devices matching the query.
trans-unit.target: A streamed set of JSON objects describing the information associated to the devices matching the query.

trans-unit.source: Each JSON object is similar to the response provided by the <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#get" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get</link> command, but only the properties matching the query are returned.Devices having an empty set of properties (regarding the query parameter) are not listed.
trans-unit.target: Each JSON object is similar to the response provided by the <link xlink:href="e17bd20e-c749-4a29-9b89-ff617c5b5bb4#get" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get</link> command, but only the properties matching the query are returned.Devices having an empty set of properties (regarding the query parameter) are not listed.

trans-unit.source: The following status code may be returned for this command:
trans-unit.target: The following status code may be returned for this command:

trans-unit.source: query parameter is invalid JSON or has a field with an unexpected value.
trans-unit.target: query parameter is invalid JSON or has a field with an unexpected value.

trans-unit.source: In this example, devices having neither gender nor favorite color are not listed..
trans-unit.target: In this example, devices having neither gender nor favorite color are not listed..

trans-unit.source: The following is another example of using the query command.
trans-unit.target: The following is another example of using the query command.
